title: Stock image sources
content:
For stock images, so far I only know Corbis, Getty images and Veer. These are great sources, but I would like to know which do you rely on when the project budget is really really low? Lets also say that the client would not appreciate any artsy stuff, they are total corporate stooges and they want to play it safe. Its sad but its a living ... =)

Thanks!

comments.content: Low Budget: You can’t do much better than [istockphoto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112909/http:/www.istockphoto.com/) and to boot there are some really useful images.
iStockPhoto’s price is hard to beat, thats a lifesaver, thanks much Tiffany!

istockphoto is good, but you can beat the price:

[http://www.sxc.hu/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112909/http:/www.sxc.hu/ "http://www.sxc.hu/")

Flickr also just started up a ’stock’ section:

[http://www.flickr.com/groups/stock/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081005112909/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/stock/ "http://www.flickr.com/groups/stock/")

Both of the above are completely free.
Aluminum, better suggestions even still. Flickr has some amazing photography. I hope the .minh contributes.
